materials.raw_text: Hg: 20 g, Nd: 15 g, Sc: 25 g, Si: 30 g, Tb: 10 g

sourcing.instructions: Hg: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in rare metals. Nd: Available from rare earth metal suppliers. Sc: Source from a specialized metal distributor. Si: Purchase from a semiconductor supplier. Tb: Obtain from a rare earth element supplier.
steps: Hg: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in rare metals. Nd: Available from rare earth metal suppliers. Sc: Source from a specialized metal distributor. Si: Purchase from a semiconductor supplier. Tb: Obtain from a rare earth element supplier.

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Hg, Nd, Sc, Si, and Tb in the specified amounts. 3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Hg, Nd, Sc, Si, and Tb in the specified amounts. 3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow complete melting and mixing of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed material into a crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 1200°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow complete melting and mixing of the components.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Avoid any rapid cooling methods to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Avoid any rapid cooling methods to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant if required for environmental protection.
